docstr: `IAND` — Bitwise logical and ### Description Bitwise logical `AND`. ### Syntax `RESULT = IAND(I, J)` ### Arguments . | `J` | The type shall be `INTEGER`, of the same kind as `I`. (As a GNU extension, different kinds are also permitted.) ### Return value The return type is `INTEGER`, of the same kind as the arguments. (If the argument kinds differ, it is of the same kind as the larger argument.) ### Example ``` PROGRAM test_iand   INTEGER :: a, b   DATA a / Z'F' /, b / Z'3' /   WRITE (*,*) IAND(a, b) END PROGRAM ``` ### Standard Fortran 95 and later ### Class Elemental function ### See also IOR, IEOR, IBITS, IBSET, IBCLR, NOT
